title: Personal Complaint #1 I feel lonely even though there are people around.
contentSnippet: Recently, I've been feeling frustrated because there have been many unpleasant things happening, and it's been affecting me to the point where I've been venting my complaints to others. If I continue like this, I might end up being disliked, so I thought about writing down my grievances. I'll probably write some really terrible things, but it would be great if there's someone who can empathize with me. Being alone is scary. Viewer discretion: This text may hurt someone's feelings. Please read it with that in mind. Also, please do not share it with my parents. If you do, I won't impose any punishment... but I'll cry. That's all. Read more.

title: Text to convert to en: I, a third grader, didn't want to go to school anymore.
contentSnippet: If you forget something, the homeroom teacher will make you do a "punishment game". If you are bad at playing the recorder, the music teacher will yell at you loudly during detention. It's nothing now, but when I was in elementary school, it was very scary for me. Every time I made a weird mistake, the class would go silent and I would be looked at with disapproving eyes. If someone tried to defend me, they would also be looked at with disapproving eyes. From the first and second grade, where everyone got along, to the day in third grade when it became about who was the smartest, I started to not want to go to school. But I am going to school today. I am filled with anxiety that I will be scolded again. I arrive at the nearest station to the school. The three-minute walk of about 200 meters feels heavy. See more

title: [ATO2] List of the Most Important Cities in the Early Stages (Updating)
contentSnippet: I have created a list of cities that should be prioritized in the early stages. Please take a look if you're interested. They are categorized into six regions: Asia, Middle East, Europe, North and South America, Africa, and Australia. I will also provide information about the economic scale of each city (combining business and tourism levels). I will list them in the order that should be considered (including places with less competition and easier battles), but please understand that there may be exceptions. Continue reading Asia.

title: If I had a lot of money, what would I do?
contentSnippet: If I had money, I thought I could do this and that, and various things. But that was just a fantasy, because when I actually bought services or products with money, I would be really happy at first, but it would wear off after about three days. Is having a lot of money really happiness? Continue reading.
